questions.question: What is the purpose of a compiler?
options: B) To translate code from one language to another
C) To compile code without errors
D) To test the code for performance
questions.answer: B) To translate code from one language to another

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a high-level programming language?
What does OOP stand for?
Which of the following is NOT one of the four main principles of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)?
Which keyword is used to define a class in Java?
Which of the following is a JavaScript data type?
Which operator is used to compare equality in JavaScript?
What does a loop do in programming?
options: B) It repeats a block of code
questions.answer: B) It repeats a block of code

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `return` keyword in JavaScript functions?
options: B) To specify the function's output
questions.answer: B) To specify the function's output

questions.question: What is the result of the expression `5 + '5'` in JavaScript?
Which of the following is used to iterate over the elements of an array in JavaScript?
Which of the following is an example of a database management system (DBMS)?
What does API stand for?
Which of the following is an example of a relational database?
What is the purpose of a version control system like Git?
options: B) To track changes in code
questions.answer: B) To track changes in code

questions.question: What does the term 'debugging' refer to?
options: C) Finding and fixing errors in code
questions.answer: C) Finding and fixing errors in code

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a programming framework?
Which type of website is built using static content?
What is the main difference between a stack and a queue?
options: A) Stack follows LIFO (Last In First Out) order; Queue follows FIFO (First In First Out)
B) Stack follows FIFO order; Queue follows LIFO order
questions.answer: A) Stack follows LIFO (Last In First Out) order; Queue follows FIFO (First In First Out)
